questions.question: The supervisor was fired because he had sticky ...................................
questions.description: When you have sticky fingers you are a thief.

questions.description: To give someone a run for their money is to compete with them at their level and make it hard for them to succeed.

questions.question: Why are you being so ..........................................?  You don't even pay for your drinks.
questions.description: To be closefisted or hardfisted is to be stingy.

questions.description: To go Dutch is to pay for your own meal.

questions.question: He had to ........................................... over a lot of money last month for violating traffic rules.

questions.description: When you are in the red, you lose more money than you make.

questions.description: To receive kickbacks is to receive bribes.

questions.question: We have been living hand to ........................................... since I lost my job.
questions.description: To live hand to mouth is to live without a lot of money.

questions.question: I don't earn much from my job as a freelance writer, but I can make ends ..........................................
questions.description: To make ends meet is to earn enough money to pay for food and bills.

questions.question: Why are you looking upset? Keep your ...................................... up.
questions.description: To keep your chin up is to stay strong.

questions.question: 'How are you doing in Singapore?' 'I'm still finding my .............................................'
questions.description: When you are finding your feet, you are adjusting to the new environment.

questions.question: I thought the interview would be difficult but it was a piece of ......................................................
questions.description: When something is a piece of cake it is easy to complete or accomplish.
